title.native: 東京喰種-トーキョーグール-:re 2

description:
The second cour of Tokyo Ghoul:re.

Kaneki Ken has finally regained memories of his former self, but this once again leaves him at a crossroads in the war between human and ghoul. After donning a pair of glasses to mirror his mentor Arima, Kaneki's new assignment is to manage the interrogation of Eto, the One-Eyed Owl, after she reveals her ghoul nature in a press conference about the publication of her newest book, which she claims will bridge the gap between the two warring sides. Now interred in Cochlea, Eto eagerly awaits the awakening of the "One-Eyed King", but only Kaneki seems to understand what she's really planning. As Aogiri Tree descends on the facility to rescue their leader, Kaneki turns to one of his oldest friends for help in his new secret mission.

(Source: Anime News Network)

The first episode was distributed online via GYAO! on September 29, 2018. TV broadcast began on October 9, 2018.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

東京喰種-トーキョーグール-:re

node.description:
[Main Twitter](https://twitter.com/sotonami) | [Secondary Twitter](https://twitter.com/sotonamix) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCefY-So0u9tiqwCL1Xw3zvA/) | [Tumblr](https://sui-zakki.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/ishida_____sui/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/ishida_sui/) | [Tumblr](https://sui-zakki.tumblr.com/)

Sui Ishida, alternatively known as Sotonami, is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known for his dark fantasy series Tokyo Ghoul, a story about a young man named Ken Kaneki who gets transformed into a ghoul after encountering one. Additionally, he is the character designer and scenario writer for the Switch game Jack Jeanne.

__Birthplace:__ Saitama Prefecture, Japan

Tooru Kitajima, better known as TK, is a singer, songwriter and the lead vocalist and guitarist of the Japanese rock band [Ling Tosite Sigure](http://anilist.co/staff/115154/LingTositeSigure). In 2011, he started to release solo material as "TK from Ling tosite sigure", and started to collaborate with Masayuki Nakano from the former electronic music band [Boom Boom Satellites](https://anilist.co/staff/103901/Boom-Boom-Satellites).

Österreich was the solo project of former the cabs guitarist Kunimitsu Takahashi.

The cabs broke up in February 2013 before going on a planned record release tour. Takahashi briefly disappeared before the band split, and later blamed the break up on his own "laziness" and mental difficulties at the time. The Band's dissolution ultimately became the catalyst that allowed for Takahashi to break out on his own.

In March 2015 österreich released a single "Munō", guest starring Ai Kamano of the alternative rock band haisuinonasa as a vocalist. The song was used as the opening theme of Tokyo Ghoul √A. In December 2018, österreich released it's second single  "Rakuen no Kimi" which was used as the ending theme for Tokyo Ghoul:re 2.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_7265687568142)

Freelancer with a desk at [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/). Nakajima is strongly associated with the animated adaptations of the works of [Rumiko Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96891/), having worked as an animation director on [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/), [Maison Ikkoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1453/) and [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) also also serving as the character designer on latter.

She is married to [Tomohiro Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/122071/).

[Website](https://www.yutakayamada.com/)

Yutaka Yamada is a Los Angeles-based music composer known for his work on the anime television series "Tokyo Ghoul", "VINLAND SAGA" and major Japanese films such as "Death Note:Light Up the New World", "BLEACH" and "KINDGOM". His masterpiece soundtracks for "Tokyo Ghoul" have gained worldwide popularity with related videos totaling over 70 million views on Youtube.

In 2018, Yamada composed for "Cry Me a Sad River", a Chinese film which had succeeded with USD $51Mil. In the same year, Eminem sampled Yamada's master piece "Glassy Sky (from "Tokyo Ghoul")" on his song "Good Guy" in his "Kamikaze" album. 
In 2019, he has worked alongside Sony Pictures for their mega-hit live-action film "KINGDOM" in which he received nomination for the 43rd Japan Academy Film Prize for Best Music Score. WIT Studio, famous for producing "Attack on Titan", released their most anticipated animation series "VINLAND SAGA", with an original soundtrack composed entirely by Yamada. 

Born in 1989, Yamada graduated from Senzoku Gakuen College of Music where he passionately studied musical composition. In 2009, he entered and won the first prize at VIENNA INSTRUMENTS Strings Arrangement Contest.

Today, he is represented by Soundtrack Music Associates, and has since relocated his production base from Tokyo to Sonic Fuel Studios in Los Angeles.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/155508177)

Photography Director affiliated with Toei Animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_7265687568142)

Freelancer with a desk at [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/). Nakajima is strongly associated with the animated adaptations of the works of [Rumiko Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96891/), having worked as an animation director on [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/), [Maison Ikkoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1453/) and [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) also also serving as the character designer on latter.

She is married to [Tomohiro Hirata](https://anilist.co/staff/122071/).

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/andrerinaldidub/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/andrerinaldidub) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/andrerinaldidub) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@andrerinaldidub) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJB9-DmISWwZaBMmDqK7i2A) | [Site Web](https://www.andrerinaldi.com)

André Augusto Rinaldi is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director. He currently directs at Grupo Macias and at DuBrasil. He is the cousin of the voice actor [Fabricio Rinaldi](https://anilist.co/staff/209058/).
